data.title: Average Mark Overall
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

l = int(input())
T = []
for i in range(l):
    inputs = input().split()
    subject = inputs[0]
    weight = int(inputs[1])
    T.append([subject,weight])

n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    subject, grade = input().split()
    max = ""
    if grade[len(grade)-1] == "%":
        grade,max = grade[:-1],"100"
    else:
        grade,max = grade.split('/')
    for t in T:
        if t[0] == subject:
            t.append(int(grade)/ int(max))
            break
R = 0
C = 0

for t in T:
    C += t[1]
    R += sum(t[2:])/(len(t)-2)*t[1]

# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)

print(str(round(R/C*100))+"%")
data.statement:
You must output the average mark overall of a student.
You will first get the weight of each subject and then a list of grades (notated as percentage or fraction) for those subjects. There can be multiple grades for the same subject.
Each grade will always be linked with a subject which weight will be known.
Weight is only applied to different subjects when calculating the overall average mark; within a subject, all grades have the same weight.

data.stubGenerator:
read L:int
loop L read Subject:word(30) Weight:int

read N:int
loop N read Subject:word(30) Grade:word(30)

write AverageMarkOverall
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[L]] representing the number of different subject.
<<Next [[L]] lines:>> One space separated string [[subject]] and integer [[weight]].
<<Next line:>> An integer [[N]] representing the number of marks of the student.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> One space separated string [[subject]] and [[grade]]. [[grade]] could be either two integers separated by a {{/}} or an integer followed by {{%}}.
data.outputDescription: The rounded average mark overall in percentage.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must output the average mark overall of a student.
You will first get the weight of each subject and then a list of grades (notated as percentage or fraction) for those subjects. There can be multiple grades for the same subject.
Each grade will always be linked with a subject which weight will be known.
Weight is only applied to different subjects when calculating the overall average mark; within a subject, all grades have the same weight.
Input
Line 1: An integer L representing the number of different subject.
Next L lines: One space separated string subject and integer weight.
Next line: An integer N representing the number of marks of the student.
Next N lines: One space separated string subject and grade. grade could be either two integers separated by a / or an integer followed by %.
Output
The rounded average mark overall in percentage.
Constraints
1 ≤ L ≤ 10
1 ≤ weight
1 ≤ N ≤ 100
Example
Input
1
math 1
1
math 50%
Output
50%
